required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: WOODCAST Hand Resting Splint - Study of User Experience
clinical_study.official_title: User Experience From WOODCAST 2mm Hand Resting Splint

oversight_info.authority: Finland: Valvira - National Supervisory Authority for Welfare and Health

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to collect comments form users of new type of hand resting splint.

detailed_description.textblock: An ecologically friendly and biodegradable wood-plastic composite cast (WOODCAST) is used as a hand resting splint in this study.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: After using hand resting splint for two weeks, patient will fill a questionaire. In the questionaire patient is asked to assess the used splint (e.g. functional performance, visual appearance), by giving points (from 1 to 10 points). Patient will use two splints from different materials during the treatment (both of the splint will be assessed by the patient).

arm_group.description: Patients with hand resting splint treatment

study_pop.textblock: Patients whos treatment involves a hand resting splint. Finnish language skills (written and spoken).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patient treatment involves hand resting splint; age of patient 18 - 90 years; skills with language Finnish language (written and spoken)
Exclusion Criteria:
- decreased co-operation of the patient; patient with multiple illnesses; malignancy; an illness affecting the general health.
